Renan Wesley Farinazzo Vitral

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9954913908478497
  • Última atualização do currículo em 01/04/2010

BIOGRAPHY RENAN WESLEY FARINAZZO VITRAL. MD, MSc, PhD. I) Post-doctoral fellowship training on Cognitive and Neural Systems, Boston University, Massachusetts, US. Supported:by The IBRO International Award. II) Professor of Neurophysiology, Biophysics, and Neural Networks III) Professor of Medical Science (AAAS/Science) IV) Chairman: Center for Computational Intelligence, Adaptive Systems and Neurophysiology - NIPAN. Department of Physiology. Biological Sciences Institute. Federal University of Juiz de Fora, BR CEP 36036-330. Juiz de Fora. MG. Brazil. TeL:Fax 5532 32121201. Home: 5532 32121201. Email: renanvitral@ieee.org; renan.vitral@ufjf.edu.br; renanvitral@uol.com.br URL: hTtp://www.linkedin/in/renanvitral Résumé. Since 2002 I had been devoted my studies to Complex Non-linear Neurodynamical Systems and the Emergence of Intentionality. My tools embrace Neural Biophysics, Neurobiology (from nano to macro), Neurochemistry, Cerebral Electrophysiology, Brain Oscillations, Computational Neuroscience, and Cognitive Modeling. It has been shown that Complex Cognitive Behavior uses hippocampus as one pathway to build many Distributed Adaptive Brain Functions. Together, it has been reported that hippocampus congregate several functions like memory, visual navigation, LTP, attention control, etc. Finally, I move my reasoning to questions about the phenomenology of the hippocampus so that a main frameworking would be guided toward the proposition of highly innovative ideas that explain a whole cognitive behavior. This will serve as a beacon to highlight the resolution of emergent brain functions needed to work on Real-time Electrophysiological Recording Techniques on Human Beings. Cognitive Brain Modeling, Complex Mathematics and Electronics became non-sufficient methods to understand any significant role of Discrete Non-linear Cerebral Oscillations on Cognition and Consciousness.These are the capital forces to be understood and we think that gradually can make us conscious about our consciousness. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Modelagem computacional de sistemas cognitivos
Descrição: Neste projeto sao estudados e desenvolvidos algoritmos matematicos para avaliacao, interpretacao e modelagem computacional de sistemas cognitivos.
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.

2005 - 2008
Inteligencia computacional aplicada a biomedicina
Descrição: Neste projeto serao utilizados parametros matematicos que embasam a construcao de softwares inteligentes, atraves da Teoria da Ressonancia Adaptativa (Grossberg, 1976), Redes Auto-organizaveis, Analise e Estudo de Sistemas Complexos e Nao-lineares, Processamento Oponente, Logica Fuzzy, dentre outros, para construcao de modelos computacionais que proporcionem otimizacao de parametros aplicaveis em biomedicina..
Situação: Desativado; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (3) / Especialização: (0) / Mestrado acadêmico: (4) / Mestrado profissional: (0) / Doutorado: (0) .

Outras informações relevantes

 
1)   Treinamento entre 01 de 2006 a 12 de 2008, referente a pos-doutoramento sob supervisao do Prof. Emilio Del Moral Hernandez, no Laboratorio de Sistemas Integraveis (LSI) da Faculdade de Engenharia Eletrica da Escola Politecnica da USP.

2)   Résumé.

      Since 2002 I had been devoted my studies to Complex Non-linear Neurodynamical Systems and the Emergence of Intentionality. My tools embrace Neural Biophysics, Neurobiology (from nano to macro), Neurochemistry, Cerebral Electrophysiology, Brain Oscillations, Computational Neuroscience, and Cognitive Modeling.

      It has been shown that Complex Cognitive Behavior uses hippocampus as one pathway to build many Distributed Adaptive Brain Functions. Together, it has been reported that hippocampus congregate several functions like memory, visual navigation, LTP, attention control, etc.
            *It is something like wonderful to study this structure, and also through an interdisciplinary approach.
      It seems that we are touching a basal level of the brain code when thinks come to make sense. Here, maybe we can find a terrific and amazed dreaming. It's by a moment we have such experience. Navigating through genome and proteome stop .definitively the searched correlation. So, again we move to chaos trying to understand  the phenomenology of the hippocampus, which could be a blurred imaging to be conscious about our limited understand of consciousness.
